chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus J Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus J Decorah is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus J Decorah was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: COSTS ARE PAID IN FULL FROM BOND

SENTENCED TO 30 days in Marquette County Jail. May transfer to Sauk County.

Report forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus J Decorah

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus J Decorah in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic tickets tracking with.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.  Traffic tickets tracking with to be dismissed.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.
Traffic tickets tracking with to be dismissed.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail 
Report forthwith
May transfer to Sauk County
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Surcharge = $200.00
Credit = 16 days

Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.
Traffic tickets tracking to be dismissed.
Return date on July 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on May 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus J Decorah in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties are close to resolution.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant has other cases that were just resolved and now can work on an agreement.  Atty Gumz asks that this be reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus J Decorah in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic tickets are tracking with.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Marcus J Decorah in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic tickets tracking with.
Atty Hendee states that time limits for Prelim were waived.  Atty Gumz agrees.  

BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Return date on February 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus J Decorah in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Defendant Marcus J Decorah in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic matters are to track with this case.  
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz requests a Prelim and waives time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.
Both traffic matters will track with this case.

Atty Hendee states that it is to his understanding that a motion was filed for bond modification by Atty Gumz.
Atty Gumz agrees and states motion requesting to lower the cash bond to $250.
Atty Hendee objects to the bond modification.
BY THE COURT:  Motion is denied; bond will remain the same.  Return date scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
